body.head: How to Cite from Schenker Documents Online

div.p: Use of any material from this website, whether for purposes of private research or for publication (paper or electronic), must be accompanied by due acknowledgment. The following form of citation is recommended: (a) the source, (b) the Document Identifier of the document quoted (see Editorial Conventions) and date, (c) the transcriber, and (d) (where applicable) the translator of that material, in the form of, for example:
Schenker Documents Online, OJ 11/16, [6] (July 18, 1927), transcr. Christoph Hust, transl. Ian Bent
Schenker Documents Online, OJ 1/18, pp. 900-901, transcr. Marko Deisinger, trans. Stephen Ferguson
Schenker Documents Online, OC 3/3, 1917/18, p. 2, transcr. Robert Kosovsky, transl. Sigrun Heinzelmann.
